name: CityLearn
description: CityLearn is an open source OpenAI Gym environment for the implementation of advanced control systems, e.g., MPC, and Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (RL) for building energy coordination and demand response in several buildings. CityLearn allows easy implementation agents in a multi-agent setting to reshape their aggregated curve of electrical demand.

sdgs.relevance:
CityLearn allows to work out how end-use energy demand can be shifted throughout the day. This helps aligning demand with availability of renewable energy resources (solar, wind), which reduces the reliance on fossil fuel powered thermal power generators.

A specific problem of reducing cost, emissions and providing grid services has been used in the 2022 CityLearn Challenge here https://www.aicrowd.com/challenges/neurips-2022-citylearn-challenge 

CityLearn can be generalized to a variety of use cases though. It is the only tool that allows to work out demand-side energy shifting at scale.
